content: Informal but accepted political title The **spouse of the president of Singapore**,[a] sometimes referred to as the **first lady** or **first gentleman**, is a title typically held by the wife or husband of the [president of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore), concurrent with the president's term in office. A courtesy term not enshrined in the [Constitution](/wiki/Constitution_of_Singapore), the spouse's role has never been [codified](/wiki/Code_of_law) or officially defined, but nevertheless figures prominently in the political and social life of Singapore. By tradition, an official [portrait](/wiki/Portrait) of the spouse of the [president of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore) is prominently displayed in government buildings and public institutions alongside the portrait of the president. [Jane Yumiko Ittogi](/wiki/Jane_Yumiko_Ittogi) is currently the spouse of the ninth [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore), after her husband [Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam) won the [2023 presidential election](/wiki/2023_Singaporean_presidential_election) with 70% of the valid votes. ## History In December 1959, [Noor Aishah](/wiki/Noor_Aishah_Mohammad_Salim), wife of President [Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak), became the first person to assume the role at the age of 26. Her biography, *Puan Noor Aishah: Singapore's First Lady*, was published in 2017. On 14 September 2017, [Mohammed Abdullah Alhabshee](/wiki/Mohammed_Abdullah_Alhabshee) became the first gentleman, after his wife [Halimah Yacob](/wiki/Halimah_Yacob) won the [2017 presidential election](/wiki/2017_Singaporean_presidential_election) by an uncontested walkover. ## List of spouses of the presidents of Singapore NoPortraitSpouse of the PresidentPresidentStart dateEnd dateRef1[Puan Noor Aishah](/wiki/Puan_Noor_Aishah) (1933–2025)[Yusof Ishak](/wiki/Yusof_Ishak)9 August 196523 November 19702[Yeo Seh Geok](/wiki/Yeo_Seh_Geok) (1917–2012) [Benjamin Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Sheares)2 January 197112 May 19813[Avadai Dhanam Lakshimi](/wiki/Avadai_Dhanam_Lakshimi) (1925–2005)[Devan Nair](/wiki/Devan_Nair)23 October 198128 March 19854[Koh Sok Hiong](/wiki/Koh_Sok_Hiong) (1916–2018)[Wee Kim Wee](/wiki/Wee_Kim_Wee)2 September 19851 September 19935[Ling Siew May](/wiki/Ling_Siew_May) (1937–1999)[Ong Teng Cheong](/wiki/Ong_Teng_Cheong)2 September 199330 July 19996[Urmila "Umi" Nandey](/wiki/Urmila_Nandey) (born 1929) [Sellapan Ramanathan](/wiki/S._R._Nathan)1 September 199931 August 20117[Mary Chee Bee Kiang](/wiki/Mary_Chee_Bee_Kiang) (born 1941) [Tony Tan Keng Yam](/wiki/Tony_Tan_Keng_Yam)1 September 201131 August 20178[Mohammed Abdullah Alhabshee](/wiki/Mohammed_Abdullah_Alhabshee)[Halimah Yacob](/wiki/Halimah_Yacob)14 September 201714 September 20239[Jane Yumiko Ittogi](/wiki/Jane_Yumiko_Ittogi)[Tharman Shanmugaratnam](/wiki/Tharman_Shanmugaratnam)14 September 2023 *Incumbent* - [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore) ## Notes This Singapore-related article is a stub.
